name: Hod Hill circular walk, Hod Hill

ai.summary: A short, easy circular hike around Hod Hill in the UK, covering about 3.9 km. The route is suitable for beginners and families, with gentle terrain and pleasant views from the hilltop.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined paths and grassy tracks, with some uneven sections and gentle ascents. Surface may be muddy after rain; expect open country lanes and farm access paths.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear suitable for uneven ground. Check weather and daylight; bring waterproofs in wetter seasons. Respect farmland and livestock; close gates behind you. Stay on official paths and be mindful of other walkers. Take a map or device, carry water, and have a plan for emergencies. In the UK, dial 999 for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device (or offline maps on phone)
Sun protection (hat, sunscreen) or warm clothing for wind
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer and Autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal, with longer daylight and milder conditions; winter can be muddy and chilly.
